---
title: "Sigma.JS new markdown example"
output: html_document
---

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r libraries}
library("sigma")
source('./sigma_json.R')
```

##Generate example data, and call R function
```{r}
#Example data
edges <- data.frame("source"=c("Glutamic Acid", "Glutamic Acid", "Glutamic Acid", "Clostridia dificile","Glutamic Acid", "E. coli"),"target"=c("Wnt", "MAPK", "Ras", "Glutamic Acid", "E. coli", "Glutamic Acid"))

nodes <- data.frame("id"=c("Glutamic Acid", "E. coli", "Clostridia dificile", "Wnt", "MAPK", "Ras"),"type"=c("compound","microbe","microbe","host","host","host"),"size"=c(4,2,2,3,2,1))

s = sigma_json_generator(nodes,edges)
```

###Call Sigma HTMLwidgets package with the example data.
```{r}
sigma(s)
```
